trans-unit.source: Represents a constructor call.
Use the <xref:System.Linq.Expressions.Expression.New%2A> factory methods to create a <xref:System.Linq.Expressions.NewExpression>.
The value of the <xref:System.Linq.Expressions.Expression.NodeType%2A> property of a <xref:System.Linq.Expressions.NewExpression> object is <xref:System.Linq.Expressions.ExpressionType.New>.
Dispatches to the specific visit method for this node type.

For example, <xref href="System.Linq.Expressions.MethodCallExpression"></xref> calls the <xref href="System.Linq.Expressions.ExpressionVisitor.VisitMethodCall(System.Linq.Expressions.MethodCallExpression)"></xref>.
This default implementation for <xref:System.Linq.Expressions.ExpressionType.Extension> nodes calls <xref:System.Linq.Expressions.ExpressionVisitor.VisitExtension%2A>.
Override this method to call into a more specific method on a derived visitor class of the <xref:System.Linq.Expressions.ExpressionVisitor> class.
However, it should still support unknown visitors by calling <xref:System.Linq.Expressions.ExpressionVisitor.VisitExtension%2A>.
The visitor to visit this node with.
The result of visiting this node.
Gets the arguments to the constructor.
The <xref:System.Linq.Expressions.NewExpression.Arguments%2A> property is an empty collection if the constructor takes no arguments.
A collection of <xref href="System.Linq.Expressions.Expression"></xref> objects that represent the arguments to the constructor.
Gets the called constructor.
The <xref href="System.Reflection.ConstructorInfo"></xref> that represents the called constructor.
Gets the members that can retrieve the values of the fields that were initialized with constructor arguments.
The <xref:System.Linq.Expressions.NewExpression.Members%2A> property provides a mapping between the constructor arguments and the type members that correspond to those values.
In the case of the construction of an anonymous type, this property maps the constructor arguments to the properties that are exposed by the anonymous type.

This mapping information is important because the fields that are initialized by the construction of an anonymous type, or the properties that access those fields, are not discoverable through the <xref:System.Linq.Expressions.NewExpression.Constructor%2A> or <xref:System.Linq.Expressions.NewExpression.Arguments%2A> properties of a <xref:System.Linq.Expressions.NewExpression> node.
A collection of <xref href="System.Reflection.MemberInfo"></xref> objects that represent the members that can retrieve the values of the fields that were initialized with constructor arguments.
Returns the node type of this <xref href="System.Linq.Expressions.Expression"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Linq.Expressions.ExpressionType"></xref> that represents this expression.
Gets the static type of the expression that this <xref href="System.Linq.Expressions.Expression"></xref> represents.
The <xref href="System.Linq.Expressions.NewExpression.Type"></xref> that represents the static type of the expression.
Creates a new expression that is like this one, but using the supplied children.
If all of the children are the same, it will return this expression.
The <xref href="System.Linq.Expressions.NewExpression.Arguments"></xref> property of the result.
This expression if no children are changed or an expression with the updated children.
Gets the number of arguments to the expression tree node.
The number of arguments to the expression tree node.
Returns the argument at index, throwing if index is out of bounds.
The index of the argument.
The argument at index, throwing if index is out of bounds.
